page.title: 09HOUSING IN FORDYCE
page.content: There is evidence in most of the houses that local limestone as well as granite and sandstone provided the building materials.During last century a number of people were employed in the Limestone quarry on the outskirts of Fordyce or in the adjoining lime- kilns.Quarry Cottages have been con- verted into the Hawthorne Restaurant. There are 58 houses in the village altogether - l7 Council,39 private,the Hawthorne Restaurant which opened a year ago and the Castle which has been unoccupied since its restoration. Further building is restricted because of the area being a conservation village,with many of the private dwellings very old & of great historic or architectural interest.There is 1 Post Office,l General & Licensed Grocer,l Painter's & l Joiner's Work- shop,annexed to or near owners' houses
